title: How To Get Your Kids To Eat More Vegetables
summary: You don’t have to give up on veggies completely if your child doesn't like them. Some veggies are just easier for kids to accept than others. You can't expect your child to go from eating nothing but pizza to eating a salad with croutons every night. It’s important to start with baby steps and work your way up. Hiding vegetables in other foods is a great way to get your kids to eat more vegetables in their diet. Don't forget dessert. Dark chocolate has lots of antioxidants and will help boost your child's immune system.

You don\u2019t have to give up on veggies completely if your child doesn\u2019t like them \u2013 but you shouldn\u2019t push it either.`),mdx("p",null,"Some veggies are just easier for kids to accept than others. Even though all veggies are nutritious, some are more nutritious than others."),mdx("p",null,"Broccoli and cauliflower are good examples of this. That way, the kids get a bit of everything they need in one go."),mdx("p",null,"You can also try hiding vegetables in other foods. At that point, you can encourage them to try new things."),mdx("h2",null,"Sneak It In"),mdx("p",null,`As we\u2019ve said, you shouldn\u2019t try to sneak all the veggies into everything, but it can be a good way to start.

They\u2019re both very mild and will barely change the flavour of the food you\u2019re adding them to."),mdx("h2",null,"Don't Forget Dessert"),mdx("p",null,`If your kid doesn\u2019t like vegetables, they\u2019re probably not getting a lot of the vitamins and minerals they need.
If they\u2019re sick often, or are just feeling really tired at the end of the day, there\u2019s a chance they\u2019re vitamin deficient. If you don\u2019t do something about it, it could lead to bigger problems down the road.
If you\u2019re having trouble getting your kid to eat vegetables, don\u2019t forget dessert.
Dark chocolate has lots of antioxidants and will help boost your child\u2019s immune system if you add it to their daily diet.
Blueberries are another great choice. They\u2019re packed with vitamins and are a delicious dessert that\u2019s easy to sneak into just about anything.`),mdx("h2",null,"Try New Foods Together"),mdx("p",null,`If you\u2019re trying to get your kids to eat more veggies, you need to try new things.
It\u2019s easy to fall into a rut with dinner and keep eating the same things over and over again. If you do that with veggies, your child is going to get bored and stop eating them. If you want them to keep eating their greens, you need to try a few new things.
Start with something simple and move up from there.
If your child has never eaten a pumpkin before, you don\u2019t want to try baking a pie, but you can make a simple pumpkin soup or stew. They\u2019ll get used to the taste and feel adventurous at the same time.`),mdx("h2",null,"Take A Break"),mdx("p",null,`Kids can be fickle, and they often go through phases where they just don\u2019t want to eat.
If your child just isn\u2019t interested in eating vegetables, there\u2019s no point in forcing them.
If you force them, they\u2019ll just push them away and resent you for it.
Instead, take a break and try again later.
Sometimes kids just need to take a break from eating vegetables until they\u2019re ready to come back to them again.
If you keep trying to get your kid to eat veggies, it\u2019ll only push them away until they\u2019re completely done with eating anything that isn\u2019t pizza.
Give them time and you might find that they\u2019re ready to try vegetables again.`),mdx("h2",null,"Summing Up"),mdx("p",null,`Kids are fickle and they don\u2019t always want to eat what\u2019s good for them. If you want them to start getting more vegetables in their diet, though, you need to start working on it early and be patient.
If you\u2019re patient, your child will learn to love vegetables and will be grateful for you later on. If they don\u2019t start eating more vegetables when they\u2019re little, though, they might end up having some health issues later on in life.
If your child isn\u2019t eating vegetables, don\u2019t worry. You can help them start eating more vegetables in no time by trying different things. Just be patient and keep trying and your child will be eating their greens in no time.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Benefits of Regular Exercise - And How to Get Started
relatedArticles.summary: Exercise is one of the best ways to reduce stress because it releases endorphins, which are hormones that help to improve your mood and reduce feelings of anxiety. People who are more physically active are less likely to develop certain types of cancers and are more likely to recover from certain diseases, such as diabetes, than people who don’t move around as much. Exercising regularly can help you to improve mental health and improve your overall health, but it also has many other health benefits. There are many different types of exercise that you can try to manage your anxiety.

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Healthier Choices When Eating Out
relatedArticles.summary: Eating out at a restaurant or a cafe is often a spur-of-the-moment affair, but knowing a little about the menu selection in advance can make a huge difference in how healthy your choice is. Go for protein and veggie-based dishes that all feature either protein or veggies as the primary source of calories. Check the calories in advance to make sure that you’re not ordering a meal that would significantly exceed your daily calorie intake. Ask the server if you can get some olive oil, vinegar, lemon, or any other healthy condiment to go with your meal.

relatedArticles.title: The Best Way to Get Your Kids to Eat Their Vegetables
relatedArticles.summary: Kids associate vegetables with being told to do something and not having the freedom to choose when or how much to eat them. This causes them to resent eating them, which makes them not want to eat. Kids also dislike vegetables because they aren’t prepared in ways that are enjoyable for them. Add Spirulina and Chlorella are two types of algae that are rich in minerals, vitamins and many other nutrients that your body needs. Add fruit to the top of your green smoothie, it will bleed into the green colour. If you want your smoothie to look green, add the greens to the bottom of the blender.

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Time for Self-Care When You're Busy
relatedArticles.summary: The best way to start your day with self-care is to set the tone for it. Journaling is a great way to get your thoughts and emotions out of your head and self-exploration. Getting at least seven hours of sleep can greatly impact your physical and mental health. Sleep deprivation is linked to a number of different health issues and can greatly affect your ability to function throughout the day. Find small windows of time to devote to self care and find ways to fit them into your day.

relatedArticles.title: The Health Benefits of Walking - And How to Get Started
relatedArticles.summary: If you have to travel to work every day, you might be able to get a bit more out of your commute. Plan your route to work or home so that it passes by a walking trail or a park. You can also try walking up stairs or taking the stairs instead of the elevator or the escalator when you can. If you can, try to walk with someone who can keep you company and help you stay focused on the walk, rather than what you’re eating. Keep a supply of healthy snacks on hand to keep you energized.

relatedArticles.title: How to Deal with Anxiety
relatedArticles.summary: Anxiety is not a disease, but it can lead to other mental health issues, such as panic attacks, phobias, and OCD. Symptoms of anxiety include restlessness, fatigue, trouble sleeping, increased heartbeat, difficulty concentrating, and a feeling of dread. Anxiety disorders affect nearly 40 million adults in the United States. If you’re experiencing anxiety, you can use the following tips to help manage it and improve your quality of life. Learn how to manage your breathing and exercise regularly to help reduce anxiety. Meditation is another great way to help you manage your anxiety.

We\u2019ve all experienced some level of anxiety from time to time \u2014 it can be perfectly normal. If you experience social anxiety or general anxiety more often than not, read on to discover how to deal with it effectively.

relatedArticles.title: The Benefits of a Plant-Based Diet
relatedArticles.summary: A plant-based diet is a type of dietary pattern that focuses primarily on whole plants such as vegetables, legumes, fruits, nuts, seeds, and grains. The benefits include improved digestive health, reduced risk of certain cancers, and better management of chronic conditions. Plant-based diets can also help with weight management and be protective against type 2 diabetes, heart diseases, and hypertension. An important advantage is that it can help people manage conditions such as gastrointestinal disorders and autoimmune diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis and multiple sclerosis.

relatedArticles.title: 10 Ways to Maximize Your Exercise
relatedArticles.summary: You don’t need to do entirely different exercises every day, but you can change the way you do things to make them more challenging. High-intensity interval training (HIIT) is a great way to burn more calories and build more endurance quickly. Stretching is an important part of any exercise routine, and stretching can help you improve your flexibility and increase the range of motion in your joints. If you want to build muscle and gain strength, you should aim to lift weights at least two times a week for 30 minutes.

relatedArticles.title: 7 Tips to Keep You Motivated When Working Out
relatedArticles.summary: If you’ve been doing the same workout routine for years, it’s time to mix things up. Mix up your workouts and add a new element to your existing routine. Identify what’�s holding you back from finding an exercise that you love. Celebrate your victories and keep track of the small victories you achieve throughout your journey. Ask for help from a professional therapist to help you through any underlying issues that hold you back. If you have anxiety, try to find ways to cope with it.

relatedArticles.summary: You can’t expect to suddenly be able to make time for yourself when you feel like you have no time at all. Make time for your social and emotional needs but if you aren't taking care of your physical needs, you will eventually feel burnt out. If you have a creative hobby, you can actually use that to help make money by scheduling it in your calendar. Make sure that you choose friends who are positive and uplifting.
